div1.p: The military career of Edmunds' is outlined until his death from yellow fever on June 18, 1899. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Resume of Frank H. Edmunds, [June 18, 1899]
div1.p: Born December 30, 1849, in Michigan, and appointed from Dakota.

He joined his regiment September 30, 18,1, and served with it at
Fort Brady, Michigan, to September, 1872; on duty at Military Academy,
West Point, to May, 1875; with regiment in Dakota, to September, 1880;
in Texas to November, 1881; Fort Leavenworth, Kansas, to May 1886; Fort
Grant, Arizona, to July, 1886; in California to October, 1893; Davids
Island, New York; to September, 1895; Professor of Military Science, at
St. Johns College, New York City, to April, 1898; on mustering duty in
Louisiana, to July, 1898; with 3d Division, 7th Corps, in Florida, to
September, 1898; on sick leave to January, 1899; Chief Ordnance Offic-
er and Adjutant General, 7th Corps, at Havana, Cuba, to February, 1899;
on leave to May, 1898; Acting Inspector General, Department of Havana,
and Pinar Del Rio, Havana, Cuba, to June. 18, 1899, when he died of
yellow fever.

{Lee from Genl Lee Quemados 18 June
" " Genl Wood - 18 June

Died Yellow fever 18th
at Quemados -
wife with him - has the fever -
Lee to father. Newton Edmunds
Yankton S D
19th June

Adjt. Genl's Office.
JUN 19 1900
Returns Division.
